description: Change of use from retail (Class A1) to retail and cafe/restaurant (Classes A1 and A3) coffee shop with use of part of the pavement in front for setting out five tables (seating ten people).
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - This development shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - Details of mitigation measures to prevent odours entering the apartment above shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of the A1/A3 use. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
To safeguard the amenities of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with Council policy DMS1. 
Condition : 3 - Details of a scheme of waste management shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of the A1/A3 use. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
In the interests of amenity and hygiene, in accordance with Council policy DMS1
Condition : 4 - Details of a scheme of sound insulation between the ground floor commercial unit and first floor apartment shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of the A1/A3 use. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
To safeguard the amenities of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with Council policy DMS1. 
Condition : 5 - Hours of operation: 0700 to 2000 Monday to Saturday and 0800 and 2000 on Sundays.
To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 
Condition : 6 - The width of the area of occupation of the external seating shall not exceed 0.8 metres.
In order to safeguard pedestrian flow on the public footpath. 
Condition : 7 - The tables and chairs as shown on approved drawing shall only be used by the public between the hours of 0800 and 2000 and shall be removed from the public highway and stored away at all other times. 
To safeguard the flow of pedestrians on the public footpath. 
Condition : 8 - REASON FOR GRANTING PLANNING PERMISSION
The Council has had regard to local development plan policies, to any representations received and to other material planning considerations. 
The following policies were considered relevant to the grant of planning permission: NPPF; DMPD (February 2012): Policies DMS1 (Sustainable design), DMS5 (Flood risk management), DMTS7 (Loss of shops outside protected parades), DMTS8 (Shopfronts and signs) and DMT1 (Transport impacts of development).
The proposal has been granted planning permission for the following reasons:
The proposed use is both acceptable in principle and should not give rise to unacceptable impacts on neighbouring occupiers.
Condition : 9 - In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
